com.taursys.xml
Class TextField

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.taursys.xml.Component
        |
        +--com.taursys.xml.Parameter
              |
              +--com.taursys.xml.AbstractField
                    |
                    +--com.taursys.xml.TextField
All Implemented Interfaces:
DocumentComponent, MapperComponent
Direct Known Subclasses:
HTMLAnchorURL, HTMLInputText, HTMLTextArea
public class TextField
extends AbstractField

A Component which receives input and/or renders text value to a Document. It responds to InputEvents and holds the given value. By default, this component uses a VariantTextModel. You can change this by overriding the createDefaultModel method or explicitly setting the model property.

This component can render its value to an xml Document (thru the DocumentAdapter). The id property indicates which element to render in the Document. The attributeName property is only used with an AttributeTextFieldRenderer to indicate which attribute to store the value in. By default, this component creates and uses a TextFieldRenderer. Override the createDefaultRenderer or use the setRenderer to use a different renderer.

Constructor Detail

TextField

public TextField()
Constructs a new TextField with a default model and renderer. The default model, a VariantTextModel, is created via the createDefaultModel method in the Parameter superclass. The default renderer, a TextFieldRenderer, is created via the createDefaultRenderer method.

TextField

public TextField(int javaDataType)
Creates a new TextField with a DefaultTextModel and VariantValueHolder of the given type. The default renderer, a TextFieldRenderer, is created via the createDefaultRenderer method. See com.taursys.util.DataTypes for defined data type constants TYPE_XXXXXX.
Method Detail

createDefaultRenderer

protected TextFieldRenderer createDefaultRenderer()
Creates the default TextFieldRenderer for this component. By Default this methos returns a new TextFieldRenderer. Override this method to define your own TextFieldRenderer.

processRenderEvent

public void processRenderEvent(RenderEvent e)
                        throws RenderException
Responds to a render event for this component. This uses the renderer subcomponent to actually render the value.
Overrides:

e - the RenderEvent to process
Throws:
